text:
Music Programs for November
NOVEMBER 1, SUNDAY
a.m. TREASURED MUSIC
9:00
Lalo—Le Roi d’Ys Overture; Boston Sym¬
phony ; Charles Munch, C.
Saint-Saens—Introduction and Rondo Cappric-
cioso; Zino Francescatti, violin; Philadelphia
Orchestra ; Eugene Ormandy, C.

“Gastein”; Vienna State Opera Orchestra; Fe¬
lix Prohaska, C.
10:00
Ravel—La Valse; Boston Symphony; Charles
Munch, C.
Elgar—Symphony No. 1 in A-Flat, Op. 65;
London Philharmonic; Sir Adrian Boult, C.
11:00

Symphony; Arturo Toscanini, C.

No. 10; Boyd Neel String Orchestra; Boyd
Neel, C.

York Philharmonic-Symphony; Bruno Walter, C.
12:00

Felix Prohaska, C.
Mozart—Divertimento No. 2 in D Major, K.
131; Royal Philharmonic; Sir Thomas Beech-
x :uu

Vienna Philharmonic; Clemens Krauss, C.

rick, harpsichordist; Frank Miller, ’cellist

Dvorak—Quintet in A for Piano and Strings,
